analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa de nyid ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of those is the apprehension of emptiness.

original: gang stong pa nyid dmigs pa de nyid de dag mi dmigs pa yin no zhes phan tshun 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid dmigs pa de nyid de dag mi dmigs pa yin no zhes phan tshun 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The apprehension of emptiness is the non-apprehension of those.

original: gnyis kyis stong pa yang gnyis kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong pa yang gnyis kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of duality is the nature of non-existence, because it is the characteristic of non-existence of duality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not apprehend form, and so on up to

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: he does not apprehend the nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa gsum yang rang bzhin gang yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gsum yang rang bzhin gang yin pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of non-entities are also of the same nature.

original: rnam pa gsum po de nyid so so zhing sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa dang sbyar na rnam pa shin tu mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de nyid so so zhing sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa dang sbyar na rnam pa shin tu mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: The three aspects are applied to each of the three kinds of entities, such as giving, the giver, and the receiver, and so on, and so there are many aspects.

original: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis stong pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis stong pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Non-entity means the aspect of emptiness of duality.

original: shes so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Knows means the meaning of understands.

original: ma byas pa ni byed pa po dang bral ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan no //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni byed pa po dang bral ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan no //
translated: Non-action means free from an agent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi rgyud kyi byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no agent in one’s continuum.

original: chos rnams chos nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan te /
analyzed: chos rnams chos nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan te /
translated: The Dharma is free from the nature of the Dharma means another aspect.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la las dang bya ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la las dang bya ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of phenomena are devoid of action and agent.

original: chos la dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: chos la dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The “thing” in the phrase “a thing in phenomena” is the relative.

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bya ba ni kun du brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bya ba ni kun du brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The “non-thing” in the phrase “a non-thing in phenomena” is the imagined and the perfect.

original: 'tshal bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'tshal bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The “not suitable to be known” in the phrase “not suitable to be known” is the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: shes pa po nyid dang mi @188a * //
analyzed: shes pa po nyid dang mi @188a * //
translated: Because it is not associated with a knower,

original: ldan pa'i phyir dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa'i phyir dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽“All phenomena are not known, so they are non-things or they are not non-things” and “it is not the case that they are not like that” are the teachings of the bodhisattvas.

original: chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal ba ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa'am dngos po ma mchis pas zhes pa dang de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' de skad du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal ba ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa'am dngos po ma mchis pas zhes pa dang de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' de skad du ston pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob
translated: This is the conventional truth of the world,

original: yin gyi / don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yin gyi / don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: but not the ultimate truth.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a misconception about the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan don dam pa yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ni log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan don dam pa yang gzhan no zhes bya ba ni log par rtog pa'o //
translated: The statement the mundane conventional is one thing, the ultimate is another is a mistaken conception.

original: lan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The reply is stated from The Lord said up to

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: one should practice the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: 'di'i don ni de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi yul du gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi yul du gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is that their suchness is the same as the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: kun rdzob ni byis pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa de bas na de nyid kyis byis pa la dngos po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni byis pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa de bas na de nyid kyis byis pa la dngos po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar brjod pa ste /
translated: The conventional is the consciousness of the childish. Therefore, by that very fact, one should say to the childish that things exist or that things do not exist.

original: de ltar bden pa gnyis la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gnyis la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is a mistaken conception of the two truths.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti up to

original: byang chub tu spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sbyor ba la log par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sbyor ba la log par rtog pa ste /
translated: one should practice for enlightenment is a mistaken conception of application.

original: 'dir de dag gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir de dag gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Here, what is the meaning of that?

original: de ltar ni mtha' gsum la dmigs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni mtha' gsum la dmigs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, observing the three extremes, the practice of generosity and so on is the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ni gang gis gang la ci zhig sbyin par 'gyur zhes sems so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ni gang gis gang la ci zhig sbyin par 'gyur zhes sems so //
translated: Otherwise, by whom, with regard to whom, and what would be given?

original: tshig gi tshogs 'og mas ni lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs 'og mas ni lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The following verse gives the reply.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub la spyod pa yin pa de bas na de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub la spyod pa yin pa de bas na de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The practice of all phenomena as emptiness is the practice of enlightenment. Therefore, that itself is the practice of the bodhisattva. This is the meaning.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having been thus addressed, the bodhisattvas...

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ste /
translated: ...therefore, he is the Buddha. This passage explains the misconception regarding the jewel of the Buddha.

original: 'dir de gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir de gang gi tshig bla dags yin zhes log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Here, what is the meaning of that? This is the misconception.

original: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: In this regard, if one thinks that because of consciousness itself, it is a buddha,

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba dang / de la shes pa dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas yin pa de'i tshe sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba shes pa gang yin pa de thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba dang / de la shes pa dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas yin pa de'i tshe sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, whatever consciousness there is of any “something” would be a buddha, and if it is a buddha because it possesses consciousness, then at that time all sentient beings would be buddhas.

original: byed pa dang ldan @188b pa'i rkyen mi rigs so //
analyzed: byed pa dang ldan @188b pa'i rkyen mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that a condition possesses an agent.

original: gzhan yang khyab pa'i rigs pas thams cad mkhyen pas na sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyab pa'i rigs pas thams cad mkhyen pas na sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if one says that because of omniscience it is called a buddha,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa grub po zhes sems so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa grub po zhes sems so //
translated: then at that time the object and subject of apprehension are established.

original: lhag ma ni lan yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni lan yin no //
translated: The rest is the response.

original: 'dir yang dag pa'i don can ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa'i don can ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, one who possesses the meaning of reality is called a buddha.

original: yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi yul gang la yod pa de ni yang dag pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi yul gang la yod pa de ni yang dag pa'i don te /
translated: The object of the meaning of reality that is unmistaken and unerring is the meaning of reality.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa rab tu gsal ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa rab tu gsal ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “buddha” is the manifestation of the single taste of the thusness of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i don gyi nges pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bshad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i don gyi nges pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, etc. states the two etymologies of the term “buddha” as it has been explained.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad do //
translated: “ Dharma” refers to all phenomena.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig par gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Truly” means having become of one taste as suchness.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus par yang dag par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni ma lus par yang dag par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “ Fully awakened” means having understood completely.

original: des zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
translated: “ By that” is the sixth case, the agent.

original: rtogs pas na sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rtogs pas na sangs rgyas te /
translated: “ Buddha” means “awakened.”

original: de 'di la shin tu ba gsum yod pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de 'di la shin tu ba gsum yod pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas te /
translated: “ Buddha” means “having three kinds of awakening.”

original: don thams cad nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu ba gsum mo //
analyzed: don thams cad nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu ba gsum mo //
translated: “ All objects,” “non-erroneously,” and “truly” are the three kinds of awakening.

original: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase realizes the ultimate means

original: chos thams cad kyi tshogs de bzhin du ro gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshogs de bzhin du ro gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: that the entire range of phenomena is of one taste, which is the ultimate.

original: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyis so //🔽'di'i don ni rtogs pas na sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyis so // 'di'i don ni rtogs pas na sangs rgyas te /
translated: The word realizes means by direct perception.

original: rab tu rtogs pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is that one becomes a buddha by realizing this, and so it is said, The one who realizes the ultimate is a buddha.🔽 The phrase realizes the ultimate is synonymous with realizes reality and realizes suchness.

original: spyi'i sgras kyang khyad par brjod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la shin tu ba 'di yod pas na sangs rgyas te don thams cad nyid dang phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i sgras kyang khyad par brjod pa'i phyir ro // de la shin tu ba 'di yod pas na sangs rgyas te don thams cad nyid dang phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is because a general term can also refer to a specific object.🔽 The one who has this realization is a buddha, and so it is said, The one who realizes the ultimate is a buddha.🔽 The meaning of the term buddha is that he has fully awakened to all phenomena just as they are.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i don dang nges pa'i tshig gzhan gyis chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na sangs rgyas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi sgra'i don dang nges pa'i tshig gzhan gyis chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na sangs rgyas zhes gsungs te /
translated: The term buddha is also defined as the one who has fully awakened to all phenomena just as they are.

original: 'dir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, all dharmas means all the dharmas of a Buddha, because they are the best.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the expression, “fully and completely awakened to, ”

original: rdzogs pa'i sgras ni sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sgras ni sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: the word “fully” refers to the awakening itself.

original: mngon pa ni de nyid ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: mngon pa ni de nyid ma lus pa ste /
translated: “ Completely” means that it is all of that.

original: spros pa thams cad kyis dben pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni shin @189a * //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad kyis dben pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i don to // ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni shin @189a * //
translated: It means that he knows the state that is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bos so //
translated: “ As they really are” means that they are the nature of the most pure reality.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi brjod par 'dod pas gcig gi tshig yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi brjod par 'dod pas gcig gi tshig yin no //
translated: “ He is called a Buddha” is a singular form because he is meant to be the general subject.

original: de ni rtogs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas yin na gang gis shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rtogs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas yin na gang gis shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: If he is a Buddha because of his realization, by what is that realization known?

original: chos de dag gang gi yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos de dag gang gi yin pa ste /
translated: It is known by those dharmas that are his.

original: nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are his because they are close to him.

original: spros pa thams cad kyis dben pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad kyis dben pa dang ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba gang las yin zhe na /
translated: From what is it known that they are free from all conceptual elaborations and that they are as they really are?

original: spyi'i sgra las kyang khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i sgra las kyang khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One understands the specific meaning from the general term.

original: de la 'dir chos kyi tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir chos kyi tshogs ni sangs rgyas kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Here, the accumulation of Dharma is the extremely pure Enjoyment Body of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin pa de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin pa de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The extremely pure reality of the Buddhas is the Essential Body, and therefore it is called Buddha.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti said...

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i bar ni chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i bar ni chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa ste /
translated: up to enlightenment is a misconception about the Jewel of Dharma.

original: chos thams cad las phul du byang ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub ni chos dkon mchog go //
analyzed: chos thams cad las phul du byang ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub ni chos dkon mchog go //
translated: Because it is the highest of all dharmas, unsurpassed enlightenment is the Jewel of Dharma.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Enlightenment and so on.

original: gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes bya ba ni log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes bya ba ni log par rtog pa'o //
translated: What is the designation? is a misconception.

original: 'di snyam du gal te rtogs pa tsam pa tsam mam khyad du 'phags pa'i shes pa byang chub yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te rtogs pa tsam pa tsam mam khyad du 'phags pa'i shes pa byang chub yin na /
translated: If realization or the exalted wisdom were enlightenment,

original: chos de gnyi ga chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: chos de gnyi ga chos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o ;
translated: then those two dharmas would not be superior to all dharmas.

original: / mdo 'og ma ni lan yin te /
analyzed: / mdo 'og ma ni lan yin te /
translated: The next sutra passage is the answer:

original: byang chub ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: Enlightenment is emptiness.

original: chos thams cad kyi spros pa thams cad dang bral bas gsal bzhin par gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spros pa thams cad dang bral bas gsal bzhin par gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the manifestation of all dharmas, free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a great absurdity.

original: de ni tshig bla dags tsam mo zhes bya ba ni brdar btags pa'i ming yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni tshig bla dags tsam mo zhes bya ba ni brdar btags pa'i ming yin gyi /
translated: It is merely a designation means it is a name that is imputed by convention.

original: don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don to //
translated: It is not the meaning means it is not the object.

original: yang na dbyer med pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don to zhes bya ba la /

original: de la 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yang med la 'on kyang gang gi tshe rnam par rtog par gyur pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa la snang bar gyur la //
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yang med la 'on kyang gang gi tshe rnam par rtog par gyur pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa la snang bar gyur la //
translated: There is nothing at all that is existent or nonexistent, but when there is conceptualization, then there is the appearance of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba na snang bar mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba na snang bar mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: When there is freedom from conceptualization, there is no appearance.

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they do not exist ultimately,

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the objects of the highest pristine awareness.

original: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not nonexistent,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the appearances of conceptualization.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rab tu 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rab tu 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
translated: The skill in discerning the dharmas is the discernment of the three natures of the dharmas.

original: gang gzhan dag las kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa gsungs pa 'dir go rims bzhin du kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs par bstan to //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag las kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa gsungs pa 'dir go rims bzhin du kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs par bstan to //
translated: The other three natures are taught in the scriptures as the imagined, the relative, and the perfect. They are taught here as imagined form, etc., imagined form, etc., and the reality of form, etc.

original: de la snang ba yin yang med pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de la snang ba yin yang med pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'o //
translated: Among them, the imagined is so called because it appears but does not exist.

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang @201b ngo ;

original: / gzhan gyi dbang la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang la kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The perfect is the emptiness of the relative with respect to the imagined.

original: dus thams cad du de kho na bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de ni rnam par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du de kho na bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de ni rnam par brtags pa ste /

original: rnam pa gzhan du yod pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yod pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The relative is imagined because it appears in one way and exists in another.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The emptiness which is the reality of phenomena is thusness.

original: de bas na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the consummate entity is called reality.

original: gsol pa / de dag gang gi rdzas su mchis gang gi rdzas su ma mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / de dag gang gi rdzas su mchis gang gi rdzas su ma mchis /
translated: He asked, “In what sense do they exist as substances? In what sense do they not exist as substances?

original: gang ni rdzas su ma mchis pa dang rdzas su mchis pa ma lags pa'i don dam pas rab tu phye ba lags /
analyzed: gang ni rdzas su ma mchis pa dang rdzas su mchis pa ma lags pa'i don dam pas rab tu phye ba lags /
translated: In what sense is the ultimate distinguished by the absence of substance and the absence of non-substance?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum po dag go rims bzhin du bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum po dag go rims bzhin du bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “The three, in order.”

analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su ma mchis par brtsis zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: kun du brtags pa la sogs pa gsum po gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa la sogs pa gsum po gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs ma yin /
translated: The three kinds of form, the imagined and so on, are not form,

original: gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: nor are they not form.

original: gang gzugs ma yin gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de ni gnyis su med de /
analyzed: gang gzugs ma yin gzugs ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de ni gnyis su med de /

analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du yin pa de bas na gnyis su med pa'i grangs su byas pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, up to the unshared qualities of a buddha are not dual, and so are counted as nondual.

translated: Śāriputra then asked, “When bodhisattvas are skilled in nonduality in this way, how should they view the thorough knowledge of defining marks, the abandonment of defining marks, the realization of defining marks, and the meditation on defining marks?”

analyzed: gsol pa / de ltar yongs su shes pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa lags /
translated: He asked, “How is it that a bodhisattva who possesses such thorough knowledge and so forth is completely emancipated?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byams pa mchog tu zab pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa mchog tu zab pa ste /
translated: “Maitreya, it is supremely profound.

original: de ltar na de mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na de mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, he is neither completely emancipated nor not completely emancipated.

original: mya ngan las ma 'das pa yang ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas 'khor ba yongs su ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las ma 'das pa yang ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas 'khor ba yongs su ma spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin la /
translated: In terms of the welfare of others, he is not completely emancipated because he does not abandon saṃsāra.

original: rang gi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma btang bas mya ngan las ma 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su ma btang bas mya ngan las ma 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: In terms of his own welfare, he is not not completely emancipated because he does not abandon complete emancipation.

original: de ni 'khor ba las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: He does not conceptualize saṃsāra as saṃsāra and nirvāṇa as nirvāṇa.

original: de bas na 'di la gnyi ga yang srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la gnyi ga yang srid par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, both are possible in this case.

original: gnyi ga la yang skyo ba med pa de bas na gnyi ga yongs su mi spong ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang skyo ba med pa de bas na gnyi ga yongs su mi spong ngo //
translated: Since neither of them is discouraged, therefore neither is abandoned.

original: gsol pa / gnyi ga ma blangs na ji ltar gnyi ga btang ba ma lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / gnyi ga ma blangs na ji ltar gnyi ga btang ba ma lags /
translated: Śāriputra said, “If neither is taken up, how is neither given up?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: gnyi ga blang ba'am blang bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra'i /
analyzed: gnyi ga blang ba'am blang bar bya ba ma yin pa mi smra'i /
translated: “I do not say that both are to be taken up or not to be taken up.

original: 'on kyang stong pa nyid la dmigs su med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa nye bar blangs nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong bar smra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang stong pa nyid la dmigs su med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa nye bar blangs nas byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong bar smra'o //
translated: However, I say that the bodhisattva does not give up nirvāṇa, having taken up the nonapprehending realm that is the object of emptiness.

original: de yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis sems la dbang du gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor bar bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bar smra'o //
analyzed: de yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis sems la dbang du gyur pa'i thabs la mkhas pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor bar bstan pa'i phyir 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong bar smra'o //
translated: And I say that the bodhisattva does not give up saṃsāra, because even though he has attained nirvāṇa, by the wisdom that has the nonconceptual realm as its object, and by skill in means that has mastery over thought, he manifests in the world systems of the ten directions in saṃsāra.”

original: chos thams cad dang / de'i stong pa nyid dang / gang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa dang / gang spros pa med pa 'di rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang / de'i stong pa nyid dang / gang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis su med pa dang / gang spros pa med pa 'di rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ma lus pa'o //
translated: All phenomena, their emptiness, and the non-duality of entity and non-entity, and the absence of conceptual proliferation, are the defining characteristics of non-conceptuality.

original: gsol pa / nyan thos thams cad zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / nyan thos thams cad zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lags sam /
translated: [Subhūti] said, “Do all śrāvakas abide in nirvāṇa, which is a one-sided peace?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @202b bka' stsal pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @202b bka' stsal pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “No, they do not.”

original: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni khams sna tshogs pa dag ste /
translated: Sentient beings have various dispositions.

original: kha cig dang po nas gya nom pa ste khyad par du 'phags pa don du gnyer te /
analyzed: kha cig dang po nas gya nom pa ste khyad par du 'phags pa don du gnyer te /
translated: Some, from the very beginning, seek the sublime, the exalted.

original: de nyid khong du chud par byed la de nyid kyis mgu par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid khong du chud par byed la de nyid kyis mgu par 'gyur ro //
translated: They understand thatness and are satisfied with that.

original: kha cig dang po nyid nas dman pa'i khyad par don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob pa des mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig dang po nyid nas dman pa'i khyad par don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob pa des mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, from the very beginning, seek the inferior. They are satisfied with attaining just that.

original: 'ga' zhig ni dang po nyid nas khyad par dman pa don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob nas de nyid kyis mi mgu bar 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni dang po nyid nas khyad par dman pa don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob nas de nyid kyis mi mgu bar 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: Some, from the very beginning, seek the inferior goal and, having attained it, are not satisfied with it.

original: de la dang po ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The first are the bodhisattvas.

original: gnyis pa ni nyan thos zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyan thos zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'o //
translated: The second are the śrāvakas who are one-sidedly devoted to peace.

original: gsum pa ni nyan thos byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyan thos byang chub tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The third are the śrāvakas who become buddhas.

original: de ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid du gyur nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid du gyur nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that, having become arhats, they seek perfect enlightenment and are reborn here and there?

original: byams pa ngas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye bar smras pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byams pa ngas las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye bar smras pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Maitreya, I do not say that they are reborn through the power of karma and moral defilement.

original: 'on kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i dgra bcom pa la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa skye bar 'gyur ba dag gis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i dgra bcom pa la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa skye bar 'gyur ba dag gis so //
translated: However, even the arhats who go to the end of nirvana are reborn through inconceivable karma.

original: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rgya che ba dang / de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa mthu che ba gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rgya che ba dang / de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa mthu che ba gang lags /
translated: He asked, “What is the vast intention of the bodhisattvas and what is their powerful superior intention?

original: des na de dag gya nom pa'i khyad par don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob par 'gyur pa lags /
analyzed: des na de dag gya nom pa'i khyad par don du gnyer zhing de nyid thob par 'gyur pa lags /
translated: Why is it that they strive for the most sublime distinction and attain just that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gang 'di ni brgya byin nyid dang 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la rnam pa thams cad du don du mi gnyer gyi bla na med pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs🔽su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: gang 'di ni brgya byin nyid dang 'jig rten skyong ba nyid dang 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la rnam pa thams cad du don du mi gnyer gyi bla na med pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: “They do not in any way strive for the mundane perfections of Śakra, the protector of the world, a universal monarch, and so forth, but rather they completely dedicate their roots of virtue to unsurpassed awakening.

original: de dag la yang chags pa med pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa med pa 'di ni de dag gis bsam pa rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang chags pa med pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa med pa 'di ni de dag gis bsam pa rgya che ba'o //
translated: They are without attachment to those and without grasping at them. This is their vast intention.

original: gang yang de la chags pa med pa'i bde ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i bde ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba /
analyzed: gang yang de la chags pa med pa'i bde ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i bde ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba /
translated: They are without attachment to happiness, without grasping at happiness, and without grasping at nirvāṇa.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed par 'dod cing byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sngo bar byed pa de ni 'dir de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed par 'dod cing byang chub chen por dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sngo bar byed pa de ni 'dir de dag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa mthu che ba'o //
translated: The great aspiration of those who wish to make it common to all sentient beings and to dedicate the roots of virtue to great enlightenment is the great power of those.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis dri ba'o //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis dri ba'o //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti asked, etc. is Subhuti's question.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lan no //🔽de @203a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lan no // de @203a * //
translated: Then the Lord, etc. is the Lord's answer.

original: bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'khrul pa log par 'dzin pa gang yin pa da dag ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na 'khrul pa log par 'dzin pa gang yin pa da dag ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: Therefore, when a Bodhisattva thus practices the perfection of wisdom, those errors, those wrong graspings, are all errors.

original: de dag kyang byams pa dang rab 'byor gyi tshig gis ston par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang byams pa dang rab 'byor gyi tshig gis ston par byed do //
translated: And those are taught by the words of Maitreya and Subhuti.

original: de dag spangs pa dang / dor ba la 'god pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas so //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa dang / dor ba la 'god pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas so //
translated: The abandonment of those and the establishment in the rejection of them is by the word of the Lord.

original: de ni 'dis phyin ci log spangs pa la 'god pa'i las te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dis phyin ci log spangs pa la 'god pa'i las te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the twenty-second activity, establishing in the abandonment of error.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti the Elder said, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis phyin ci log bzhi med pa la 'god pa'i las so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis phyin ci log bzhi med pa la 'god pa'i las so //
translated: up to there is no defilement and purification. This is the activity of establishing in the nonexistence of the four errors.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti, etc.

original: tshig gi lam las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par byang ba la 'god pa'i las so //
analyzed: tshig gi lam las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par byang ba la 'god pa'i las so //
translated: up to beyond the path of speech. This is the activity of establishing in purification.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Lord, etc.

original: don dam par ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la 'god pa'i las so //
analyzed: don dam par ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la 'god pa'i las so //
translated: up to not ultimately. This is the activity of establishing in the accumulation of purification.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Lord, the Tathagata has fully known a dharma, etc.

original: khyu mchog gi mthar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha mi dad par shes pa la 'god pa'i las so//🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi mthar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas tha mi dad par shes pa la 'god pa'i las so// gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “he is not the best of the herd” up to “he is not the final goal” is the activity of establishing in the nondiscrimination of the compounded and the uncompounded.

original: yod par 'gyur re skan zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i las so //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur re skan zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod pa'i las so //
translated: The passage from “Subhuti said” up to “he is not the final goal” is the activity of establishing in nirvana.

original: de ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las nyi shu rtsa bdun bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi sku'i phrin las nyi shu rtsa bdun bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the twenty-seven activities of the Dharma Body.

original: ji ltar na sku gsum po chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sku gsum po chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the three bodies are the Dharma Body?

original: gzhes shing nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur bas na chos so //
analyzed: gzhes shing nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur bas na chos so //
translated: It is Dharma because it is not destroyed, and it is body because it is the body of that.

original: chos kyang 'di yin la sku yang 'di yin pas na chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: chos kyang 'di yin la sku yang 'di yin pas na chos kyi sku ste /
translated: It is Dharma and it is body, and so it is the Dharma Body,

original: lus nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the body itself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The body of the Tathagata is permanent.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, the essential body is permanent because it is permanent by nature.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without beginning and end.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'jig pa med pa'i rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni 'jig pa med pa'i rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa ste /
translated: The enjoyment body is permanent because of its permanence as non-destruction.

original: thog ma dang ldan yang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //🔽sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun chags pa'i rtag pas rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: thog ma dang ldan yang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro // sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun chags pa'i rtag pas rtag pa yin te /
translated: It is endowed with a beginning, but not with an end.🔽The emanation body is permanent because of its permanence as continuity.

original: yul tha dad par rtag par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad par rtag par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is permanent in the sense of being engaged as different objects.

original: de bzhin du mdzad pa yang rtag @203b par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzad pa yang rtag @203b par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, its action is also engaged as permanent.

original: ji ltar na mdzad pa chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mdzad pa chos kyi sku yin zhe na /
translated: How is the action of the Dharma body?

original: mdzad pa dang mdzad pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa dang mdzad pa po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the action and the agent.

original: ji ltar na rnam pa bzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa bzhi yin zhe na /
translated: How is it of four kinds?

original: 'jig rten pas tha dad pa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas tha dad pa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is imagined as different by the mundane.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig la bsdus pa'i don rnam pa brgyad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig la bsdus pa'i don rnam pa brgyad bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is shown to be included in the one, and is eightfold.

original: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
translated: their conclusion, and their result.

original: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug /'di ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don gzhan rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug /'di ni 'di'i bsdus pa'i don gzhan rnam pa drug ste /
translated: This has another sixfold summary meaning.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid ni kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid ni kun mkhyen rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, the characteristics are the three knowledges.

original: mtshan nyid de'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of those characteristics

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //🔽sbyor ba'i rab ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o // sbyor ba'i rab ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: is the complete realization of all aspects.🔽The culmination of application is the realization of the peak.

original: sbyor ba'i go rims ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i go rims ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The sequence of application is the realization in sequence.

original: sbyor ba'i mtha' ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtha' ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The conclusion of application is the realization in a single moment.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The result of application is the dharmakāya.🔽The cause of the object, the three kinds,🔽the essence of the four applications,

original: yul gyi rgyu ni rnam gsum dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: yul gyi rgyu ni rnam gsum dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
translated: the dharmakāya, activity, and result

original: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //
translated: are another threefold summary.

original: 'di ni 'di'i don bsdus pa gzhan rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i don bsdus pa gzhan rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: This is another threefold summary of the meaning of the verse.

original: rgyu dang sbyor ba dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang sbyor ba dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Cause, application, and result.

original: de ltar rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, the cause is threefold.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni sbyor ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum ni sbyor ba'i yul lo //
translated: The three knowledges are the object of application.

original: sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The essence of the four applications is the realization of all aspects, the culminating application, the sequential application, and the instantaneous application.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku dang chos kyi sku de'i phrin las kyang ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku dang chos kyi sku de'i phrin las kyang ngo //
translated: The result of application is the Dharma body and the activity of that Dharma body.

original: thub pas tshig gi spyod yul dag las 'das par mkhyen nas gsung gi pha rol phyin mchog gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: thub pas tshig gi spyod yul dag las 'das par mkhyen nas gsung gi pha rol phyin mchog gang gsungs pa //
translated: The Sage, knowing that the three bodies transcend the domain of words, has spoken the supreme perfection of wisdom.

original: la lar gzhan gyi stobs las cung zhig bas gas par gyur kyang bdag la de don brjod nus ga la yod //
analyzed: la lar gzhan gyi stobs las cung zhig bas gas par gyur kyang bdag la de don brjod nus ga la yod //
translated: In some places, a little is understood from the power of others, but how can I express that meaning to myself?

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas yum gyi mngon rtogs rgyan gyi 'grel byas las //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas yum gyi mngon rtogs rgyan gyi 'grel byas las //
translated: I have composed a commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the Mother of the Buddhas.

original: shel ltar dangs shing mkha' bzhin mnyam med bsod nams gang thob pa //🔽de las byang chub chen po thob nas 'gro ba mtha' med pa'i //
analyzed: shel ltar dangs shing mkha' bzhin mnyam med bsod nams gang thob pa // de las byang chub chen po thob nas 'gro ba mtha' med pa'i //
translated: Whatever merit I have gained, as pure as crystal, as immeasurable as space,🔽May all beings, having attained the great enlightenment from that,

original: lam gyur srog chags kun gyis de las rtag pa'i gnas thob shog / mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi ni //
analyzed: lam gyur srog chags kun gyis de las rtag pa'i gnas thob shog / mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi ni //
translated: Always attain the state of the end of the path of infinite migrators.

original: 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya @204a * //
analyzed: 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya @204a * //
translated: The commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization, called Pure Wisdom,

original: ba ; / rin chen 'byung gnas 'bad pa yis //
analyzed: ba ; / rin chen 'byung gnas 'bad pa yis //
translated: Was composed by Ratnamati

original: mdor bsdus tshig gsal sbyar ba yin //
analyzed: mdor bsdus tshig gsal sbyar ba yin //
translated: In a concise and clear manner.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub brnyes pa dang / mkhas pa chen po rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi dngos grub brnyes pa dang / mkhas pa chen po rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas mdzad pa /
translated: Attained the siddhi of Arya Manjushri, and the great scholar Ratnamati composed this.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization called Pure Wisdom is complete.

original: // / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag lha btsan po khri bkra shis 'od lde btsan gyi bkas rgya gar gyi mkhan po shr'i su bh'u ti sh'anti'i zhal snga nas dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya blo gros dang / dge slong dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
analyzed: // / dbang phyug dam pa'i mnga' bdag lha btsan po khri bkra shis 'od lde btsan gyi bkas rgya gar gyi mkhan po shr'i su bh'u ti sh'anti'i zhal snga nas dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya blo gros dang / dge slong dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
translated: By the order of the divine king, the lord of the holy power, the great sovereign Tri Tashi Oede, the Indian abbot Shri Subhuti-shanti, and the translators, the monks Shakya Lodro and the monk Gewe Lodro, translated, revised, and finalized it.

original: / slad kyi pandi ta chen po sh'anta bha dra dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba 'gos lhas btsas kyis gtan la phab ste bcos pa'o//
analyzed: / slad kyi pandi ta chen po sh'anta bha dra dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba 'gos lhas btsas kyis gtan la phab ste bcos pa'o//
translated: Later, the great pandit Shantibhadra and the great translator Go Lhewechen revised and finalized it.
